snippet: After a heart attack, Dee Williams downsized. Way down.
abstract: Dee Williams writes in her new memoir, The Big Tiny, how and why she decided to downsize her life following heart attack; inspired by trip she took to impoverished area in Guatemala, and growing sense her life was being consumed by household chores, Williams sold her three-bedroom bungalow in Portland, Ore, trading it in for 84-square-foot house she put on metal truck trailer and drove to Olympia, Wash.
lead_paragraph: After a heart attack, Dee Williams downsized. Way down.
